Dear Ms. Westphal:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
11/30/2022. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules a written corrective action
plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations
of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616)204-6992.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 (e) Employee records
Rule 113. An institution shall maintain employee
records for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information prior to
employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee
and which are less than 12 months old.
One of eleven new employee records reviewed contained one reference from a
relative of the individual of the three in the file.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection dated 12/09/2021, CAP approval date 12/09/2021
R 400.4113 (i) Employee records
Rule 113. An institution shall maintain employee
records for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information prior to
employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of
human services, the equivalent state or Canadian
provincial agency, or equivalent agency in the country
where the person usually resides, that the person has
not been determined to be a perpetrator of child abuse
or child neglect. The documentation shall be completed
not more than 30 days prior to the start of employment
and every 12 months thereafter.
Two of eleven employee records reviewed did not contain current documentation
from the Michigan Department of Human Services confirming that the individual
has not been determined to be a perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
R enewal Inspection dated 12/09/2021, CAP approval date 12/09/2021.

R 400.4150 (4) Incident reporting
(4) When a resident’s behavior results in contact with
law enforcement, the incident shall be reported to the
parent/legal guardian, responsible referring agency,
and the licensing authority as soon as possible, but not
more than 24 hours after the incident.
One of four incident report reviewed did not contain documentation that the
Licensing authority was contacted in response to Law Enforcement involvement.
R 400.4154 (2) Shelter care and detention institutions; service
plans
(2) Copies of the plan shall be maintained at the
institution.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted 3 acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The inspection completed on 12/09/2021 contained 17 rule violation findings. A
corrective action plan was submitted and approved on 12/09/2021. There were two
repeat violations contained in this inspection. There were two corrective action plans
during this report period as a result of a investigations. The first was approved on
02/23/2022 as a result of SIR#2022C0137007. The second corrective action plan
was approved on 06/21/2022 as a result of SIR # 2022C0325013. Both corrective
action plans were centered around rule 400.4159 Youth restraints. The facility has
been found in compliance with agreed upon methods of the corrective action plan
involving re-training MACH restraint techniques and new methods of tracking training
compliance.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
